chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy J Alft was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.075(1r).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence credit for 7 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Bail applied to Costs/DNA Surcharge.  Paid in full.  Remainder of bail to be refunded to poster.

No unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18 without prior Agent approval.
No possession or use of a computer or any technological device with Internet capabilities without prior permission from the Agent.
Comply with all conditions of Sex Offender Program.
Compliance with DNA testing and pay for same.
Cooperate, attend and participate in all treatment programs recommended by your Agent, including Sex Offender Treatment.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 05/06/21.

LF 5/7--sent electronically to DOC via interface; mailed copy to defendant.

**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 05/04/21--Denied. Adjustment would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense and is not in the interests of justice. The Court further notes that Mr. Alft received the presumptive minimum term of initial confinement, thus further supporting the denial of the request.**

records.addlTxt: Filed by Court Reporter, Deidre Thies - From  Sentencing Hearing Held on 01/18/17.

Defendant Jeremy J Alft in court with attorney D. Nicholas Carroll.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court previously found the defendant guilty of Count #1. State makes recommendations. Atty. Carroll makes statements. Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following: Count #1

Imposed Sentence of:

6 Years and 6 months Imprisonment (Credit - 7 days)
-	5 Years of Initial Confinement
-	18 months of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
	
-No unspervised contact with anyone under the age of 18 without prior agent approval.

-Comply with all conditions of sex offender program.

-Compliance with DNA testing and pay for same.

-Cooperate, attend and participate in all treatment programs recommended by your agant, including Sex Offender Treatment

-No possession or use of a computer or any technological device with internet capabilties without prior permission from the agent. 

Costs: $268.00 to be paid as a condition of extended supervision 

DNA surcharge: $250.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Costs and surcharges to be paid through cash bail, remainder to be refunded to poster. 

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on January 18, 2017 at 04:00 pm.
